title: In Firing His No. 2, Zelensky Loses Both a Negotiator and an Enforcer
summary: Andriy Yermak had ensured internal discipline in Ukraine’s wartime politics. He also led the country’s peace negotiations, which now must go on without him.

title: The Ukrainians Stuck in Russia’s New Gulag
summary: Even if a peace can be reached, it won’t be easy to solve the problem of Ukrainian civilians languishing in Russian jails. This is one prisoner’s story.

title: Russia Bombards Ukraine for Nearly 10 Hours in a Deadly Assault
summary: The attack came as U.S. officials were expected to hold peace talks with Ukrainian and Russian officials in the coming days.

title: South Africans Were Promised Job, but Ended Up ‘Going to War’ for Russia
summary: The South African government is investigating how more than a dozen men unwittingly ended up on the front line in Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: Trump to Pardon Juan Orlando Hernández, Honduran Ex-Leader Convicted in Drug Case
summary: Juan Orlando Hernández was accused of receiving millions in bribes and partnering with cocaine traffickers. He was convicted in Manhattan in 2024 and sentenced to 45 years in prison.

title: Trump Declares Venezuelan Airspace Closed
summary: President Trump said days earlier that the United States could “very soon” expand its campaign of killing people at sea suspected of drug trafficking to attacking Venezuelan territory.

title: Latin American Leaders Face Both Trump and Voters Deported by the U.S.
summary: The upcoming election in Honduras shows how politicians must balance cooperation with the Trump administration with their obligation to undocumented citizens in the United States who may be deported.

title: F.D.A. Seeks More Oversight of Vaccine Trials and Approvals
summary: The agency’s top vaccine regulator proposed broad changes, claiming that a new review linked 10 children’s deaths to the Covid vaccine. But public health experts questioned the findings, wanting to examine the data.

title: Inside Trump’s Push to Make the White House Ballroom as Big as Possible
summary: President Trump’s ever-growing vision has caused tension with contractors. His architect has taken a step back as the president personally manages the project.

title: How Fraud Swamped Minnesota’s Social Services System on Tim Walz’s Watch
summary: Prosecutors say members of the Somali diaspora, a group with growing political power, were largely responsible. President Trump has drawn national attention to the scandal amid his crackdown on immigration.

title: Deadly Hong Kong Fire Is a Test of Beijing’s Rule in the City
summary: After Beijing reshaped the political order in Hong Kong in its image, the fire has become a test of how well that new system can govern in a crisis.

title: A Classical Pianist’s Plea: Make Messy Art
summary: It is not only classical musicians who are being stunted by the search for perfection. It is harming many aspects of our lives and sectors of our society.

title: America’s Caregivers Are in Crisis
summary: Caregivers are at the brink of despair.

title: Highlight Reel
summary: As the year comes to a close, we want to know your highly specific, idiosyncratic bests of 2025.

title: Tom Stoppard, Award-Winning Playwright of Witty Drama, Dies at 88
summary: Drawing comparisons to the greatest of dramatists, he entwined erudition with imagination in stage works that won accolades on both sides of the Atlantic.

title: Shoppers, Drawn by Steep Discounts, Power Through Black Friday
summary: Data on spending this week shows that consumers are shopping big for the holidays despite inflation and economic worries.

title: Did Pope Leo Pray in Istanbul’s Blue Mosque? Not Visibly, at Least.
summary: Leo XIV is being closely watched on an inaugural trip to Turkey and Lebanon to spread a message of peace and outreach.

title: Israeli Hostage Recounts Beatings and Starvation During Hamas Captivity
summary: Segev Kalfon said he endured physical abuse and mind games during 738 days in the hands of Hamas. Now, he asks why it took so long for Israel to bring him home.
